p: The 1500 cm −1 region corresponds to the digital fingerprint of the spectrum, in which there is a large number of absorptions due to a variety of vibrations of simple bonds [ 75]. The absorption bands at 1078, 1077, 950, 996, and 926 cm −1 correspond to C–OH and CH 2 deformations [ 74]. According to Lima et al. [ 74], the absorption bands in the region of 1200 to 1000 cm −1 are characteristic of starch, attributed to vibrations of axial deformation of C–O and O–C–O.
